hanzi-su-wiki:
間

Значения

Промежуток, расстояние; период времени; свободное место; свободное время; комната; мера длины 1,81 м

Мнемоника


Зазор створок ворот 門, куда заглядывает солнце 日.

Варианты

閒, 间
purpleculture_pinyin:
jiān
between; among; within a definite time or space; room; section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars; classifier for rooms
между; среди; в течение определенного времени или пространства; комната; сечение комнаты или боковое пространство между двумя парами столбов; классификатор помещений

jiàn
gap; to separate; to thin out (seedlings); to sow discontent
зазор; разделять; проредить (рассаду); сеять недовольство

purpleculture_examples:
間接 [ jiàn jiē ]: indirect
間斷 [ jiàn duàn ]: disconnected; interrupted; suspended; a gap; a break
間隔 [ jiàn gé ]: gap; interval; compartment; to divide; to separate; to leave a gap of (two weeks, three meters etc)
間隙 [ jiàn xì ]: interval; gap; clearance
間諜 [ jiàn dié ]: spy

• ⿵ Surround from above

heisig_chinese_memo: The interval between star systems (suns) was too large, so the stargates were created to travel between them.
heisig_story: Gates . . . sun/day. This interval applies to time and space alike, but the latter is better for creating an image.
koohiiStory1: The interval between star systems (suns) was too large, so the stargates were created to travel between them.
koohiiStory2: We open the gates at regular intervals to let a bit of sun in.

jp_readingExamples: 間隔 (かんかく), 中間 (ちゅうかん), 時間 (じかん), 間 (あいだ), 間 (ま)
WaniKani_Kanji_Meaning: Interval, Interval Of Time, Time Interval
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Think of a gate that the sun has to go through every time it revolves around in the sky (this is ancient China's sun). Someone at the gate checks the time, and makes sure the interval is correct, then waves it through the gate for another pass, where it creates its next interval of time.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: "Interval" is a weird word to remember, but just think of the sun going around the earth and through the gate just like clockwork. Every 24 hours it passes through the gate, and each interval is exactly the same.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic:
This method of keeping track of intervals of time was invented by the great Khans of Mongolia, specifically the most famous Khan of all: Genghis Khan (かん).
Genghis Khan has had a huge impact on the world as we know it, especially the Eurasian continent of the past, so he's going to come up a lot from now on. Be prepared to get very familiar with him and his friends!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Picture Genghis Khan ordering his most skilled inventors and builders to create this special sun gate so they can harness the power of intervals, and all people under his rule can benefit from the accurate telling of time.
Ru_trainchinese:
jiān: (сущ/сч.слово) пространство между; в определенный промежуток времени, на определенном пространстве; комната; счетное слово для комнат
jiàn: (графема) щель, зазор, промежуток, интервал; отделять, держать в стороне; сеять вражду, вносить разлад
jiàn: (глаг) редеть
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the sun (日) is under the gate (門) for an interval
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: The interval between star systems (suns) was too large, so the stargates were creaated to travel between them.
humanum_full_description_en:
Inscriptions from the " door " from the " Day " represents the sun shine from the door to come in, the door is the original meaning of a gap, Extension refers to "the gap in the space gap between " is a gap of " free variant forms" of " Xiang " is also extended as a gap in time. The meaning of free and leisure is represented by the word " Free " (simplified word is ""), while the meaning of interval (representing the distance between time and space) remains in " between. " And the word " Free ". Cao Zhi, "Gift to the White Horse Wang Biao": "White and black among the flies, slanderous makes kisses." It means that the patterns of flies are black and white, and the slanderous words alienate relatives. From the distance and the gap, it is extended to the gap and the gap, "Zuo Zhuan. "The 27th Year of Aigong": "Therefore, there are many rooms between the emperor and his ministers." The idiom "intimate" refers to a close relationship without barriers. It can also be used as a verb to express separation and alienation, "Yi Zhou Shu. "Wu Ji": "It is sparse, and its doubts are thin." Zhu Youzeng's interpretation: "It means to set things up for separation." The whole sentence means alienated courtiers and persecutes suspicious officials.

The distance between the two things is the middle of the two, so the middle is extended by extension. "easy. Gua Preface: "The only thing between heaven and earth is everything." "Lu Shi Chun Qiu. Funeral": "Born between Heaven and Earth."

Jinwen is suspected to be a place name, Jianyoukugo: "Jianyouku", "youku" refers to Right Hyogo, distinguished from Zuo Hyogo, the whole sentence refers to the right Hyogo, "Classification. "Menbu": "Jian, place name, "Chun Qiu Chuan": "Dasou Yu Changjian"." It may also be borrowed as " Xian ", referring to You Hyogo (Shen Pei) in the county. The bamboo slips of the Warring States period borrowed " xian " as " county ", "Tsinghua Bamboo Slips II. "Xian Nian" Jian 99: "𨳿 (Xian-County) Chen, Cai", referring to Chen Di and Cai Di as the county.
humanum_short_description_en: Synopsis: The inscription from the " door " to the " day " means that daylight is seen from the crack of the door. The original meaning is that the door has a gap.
humanum_full_description:
金文從「門」從「日」，表示日光從門縫中照進來，本義是門有間隙，引申指空間上的間隙、縫隙，「間」是表示空隙的「閒」的異體字，「閒」又引申為時間上的空隙，空閒、閒暇之義用「閒」字表示（簡化字作「闲），而間隔之義（表示時間和空間上的距離）則同時保留在「間」和「閒」字中。曹植〈贈白馬王彪〉：「蒼蠅間白黑，讒巧令親疎。」意指蒼蠅的花紋黑白相間，讒言巧語使親人疏離。由間距、空隙，引申為嫌隙、隔閡，《左傳．哀公二十七年》：「故君臣多間」，意指君與臣疏遠，多有隔膜。成語「親密無間」指關係密切，沒有隔閡。又可用為動詞，表示離間、使疏遠，《逸周書．武紀》：「間其疏，薄其疑。」朱右曾校釋：「間，謂設事以離間之。」全句意謂離間疏遠的臣子，逼迫有疑心的官員。

　　兩物相隔之處是二者的中間，故又引申表示中間。《易．序卦》：「盈天地之間者唯萬物。」《呂氏春秋．節喪》：「生於天地之間」。

　　金文疑為地名，間右庫戈：「間右庫」，「右庫」指右兵庫，以別於左兵庫，全句疑指間地的右兵庫，《類篇．門部》：「間，地名，《春秋傳》：『大蒐于昌間』。」也可能假借為「縣」，指縣裏的右兵庫（沈培）。戰國竹簡借「閒」為「縣」，《清華簡二．繫年》簡99：「𨳿（閒─縣）陳、蔡」，指以陳地、蔡地為縣。
humanum_short_description: 金文從「門」從「日」，表示從門縫中看到日光，本義是門有間隙。

    English Definition: gap; to separate; to thin out (seedlings); to sow discontent

    間隙 [ jiàn xì ]: interval; gap; clearance
    間諜 [ jiàn dié ]: spy

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(間 meaning time as measured by the sun. is a modification of 閒 meaning leisure time when the gate was closed and the moon was up)

  • ⿵ Surround from above
    • 門 [ mén ] gate, door, entrance, opening
    • 日 [ rì ] sun; day; daytime
①兩段時間相接的地方，或介於兩樁事物當中及其相互關係：中間。間距。間奏。天地之間。
②在一定空間或時間內：田間。人間。
③房子內隔成的部分：裏間。衣帽間。間量。
④量詞，房屋的最小單位：一間房。
⑤一會兒，頃刻：瞬間。
⑥近來。
①空隙：間隙。當間兒。親密無間。
②隔開，不連接：間隔。間斷。間接。間日。間歇。黑白相間。
③挑撥使人不和：離間。間諜。反間計。
④拔去，除去：間苗。
⑤偏僻的小路：間道。間行(從小路走)。
⑥參與：“肉食者謀之，又何間焉”。

間隔 [ jiàn gé ]: gap; interval; compartment; to divide; to separate; to leave a gap of (two weeks, three meters etc)
間隙 [ jiàn xì ]: interval; gap; clearance
間諜 [ jiàn dié ]: spy

金文從「 門 」從「 日 」，表示日光從門縫中照進來，本義是門有間隙，引申指空間上的間隙、縫隙，「 間 」是表示空隙的「 閒 」的異體字，「 閒 」又引申為時間上的空隙，空閒、閒暇之義用「 閒 」字表示（簡化字作「闲），而間隔之義（表示時間和空間上的距離）則同時保留在「 間 」和「 閒 」字中。曹植〈贈白馬王彪〉：「蒼蠅間白黑，讒巧令親疎。」意指蒼蠅的花紋黑白相間，讒言巧語使親人疏離。由間距、空隙，引申為嫌隙、隔閡，《左傳．哀公二十七年》：「故君臣多間」，意指君與臣疏遠，多有隔膜。成語「親密無間」指關係密切，沒有隔閡。又可用為動詞，表示離間、使疏遠，《逸周書．武紀》：「間其疏，薄其疑。」朱右曾校釋：「間，謂設事以離間之。」全句意謂離間疏遠的臣子，逼迫有疑心的官員。 兩物相隔之處是二者的中間，故又引申表示中間。《易．序卦》：「盈天地之間者唯萬物。」《呂氏春秋．節喪》：「生於天地之間」。 金文疑為地名，間右庫戈：「間右庫」，「右庫」指右兵庫，以別於左兵庫，全句疑指間地的右兵庫，《類篇．門部》：「間，地名，《春秋傳》：『大蒐于昌間』。」也可能假借為「 縣 」，指縣裏的右兵庫（沈培）。戰國竹簡借「 閒 」為「 縣 」，《清華簡二．繫年》簡99：「𨳿（閒─縣）陳、蔡」，指以陳地、蔡地為縣。

The meaning of free and leisure is represented by the word " Free" (simplified word is ""), while the meaning of interval (representing the distance between time and space) remains in " between." And the word " Free". Cao Zhi, "Gift to the White Horse Wang Biao": "White and black among the flies, slanderous makes kisses." Compound 間 from gate (门)門 mén and sun-day 日 rì see 閒 simp 间

Decomposition notes 字形分解说明 :
(間 meaning time as measured by the sun. is a modification of 閒 meaning leisure time when the gate was closed and the moon was up)

вм. 间

間

Значения

Промежуток, расстояние; период времени; свободное место; свободное время; комната; мера длины 1,81 м

Мнемоника


Зазор створок ворот 門, куда заглядывает солнце 日.

Варианты

閒, 间

Radicals: 門, 日  (gate, sun)
Meaning Mnemonic
Think of a gate that the sun has to go through every time it revolves around in the sky (this is ancient China's sun). Someone at the gate checks the time, and makes sure the interval is correct, then waves it through the gate for another pass, where it creates its next interval of time.
"Interval" is a weird word to remember, but just think of the sun going around the earth and through the gate just like clockwork. Every 24 hours it passes through the gate, and each interval is exactly the same.
Reading Mnemonic
This method of keeping track of intervals of time was invented by the great Khans of Mongolia, specifically the most famous Khan of all: Genghis Khan (かん).
Genghis Khan has had a huge impact on the world as we know it, especially the Eurasian continent of the past, so he's going to come up a lot from now on. Be prepared to get very familiar with him and his friends!
Picture Genghis Khan ordering his most skilled inventors and builders to create this special sun gate so they can harness the power of intervals, and all people under his rule can benefit from the accurate telling of time.
